page.title: 14NACTON C.OF E. CHURCH
page.content: St. Martin's Church was built in the 11th century out of stone and wood. Its site was probably chosen because of its defensive position. As the population grew, the Nave and then the tower with the bells were added. Later on a Chapel was built and dedicated to the Broke family. There is also a monument to Admiral Vernon, who was nick-named Grog. Another aisle was built eight years ago. There is now a leak in the roof over the North Aisle and the Church has appealled for money repair it. The services for Orwell Park School are held there. The Church shares its Rector with parishes of Levington and Bucklesham.
